Special Events and Film Permits
Special Events and Film Permits
Special events are a great way to highlight your organization and the community to both visitors and residents of Coral Gables. Below are forms to fill out for the permits, contact information, and additional information. It is the City of Coral Gables’ objective to help make sure that the event is safe, successful and planned effectively.
Contact Information
Special Events Contact
:
specialevents@coralgables.com
Film Permit Contact
:
filmpermits@coralgables.com
or call
305-460-5605
.
The submission of a Special Events Permit Application may be one of several applications an event organizer may need to submit. The responses to questions in the application will help the city inform you of other necessary permits and approvals needed.
Forms
Alcoholic Beverage and Tobacco Application Special Event Permit
Film Permit Ordinance [PDF]
Film/Photo Permit Application [PDF]
Off-Duty Police Permit [PDF]
Special Events Application Form [PDF]
Film and Photography Rules
1. Determine Location
This permit only covers filming/shooting in The City of Coral Gables. Please use our mapping tool to ensure your desired location resides in The City.
City of Coral Gables Overlay Map
If the location is in the highlighted area (outlined by zone 1,2,3 & 4), you're in The City of Coral Gables.
2. Collect Documents
Due to the high volume of applications our office has been receiving, in order to serve you better we are asking that all Film Permit applications with street closures be submitted at least 14 -21 business days prior to the shoot, and all other Film Permit applications be submitted at least 14 business days prior to the shoot.
You must complete this application at least two-three weeks prior to your film (including the notarized page)
Site map must be attached to application
Insurance must be attached to application
Obtain consent from the HOA (if applicable)
Obtain consent from Homeowners (if applicable)
Letter of notification, either residential or commercial
Look up Your Address Using our Mapping Tool
Start by looking  up the property in question (for a permit, event, etc.)
City of Coral Gables- Zoning FL Zoning Map Search | Gridics
3. Insurance
Proof of insurance is required for the application procedure. Without insurance, the permit will not be approved. Certificate Of Insurance: Page 3 contains specific insurance requirements for the Film and Photography permit.
4. Pay Invoice
Fees must be paid online through link provided by Special Events staff once permit is approved.
You will receive an invoice from any departments that are needed including police, fire, parks, etc. You must pay your invoice before your permit will be issued.
Pay Invoice
5. Await Approval
If we have any questions about your application, we will contact you. Once all departments have approved and your invoice has been paid, we will send you the film permit via email.
Film Permit Fees
Commercial Permits
Still Photography, per day/location: $74
Video/Movie, per day/location: $335
Still Photography at City Facility, per day/location: $468
Video/Movie at City Facility, per day/location: $1,216
Residential Permits:
Still Photography Outside (Outside structure or residence), per 3 days: $214
Video/Movie Photography (Outside structure or residence), per 3 days: $214
Major Motion Picture, per 14 days: $366
Country Club Prado:
Still Photography, per day/location: $98
Video/Movie, per day/location: $335
Venetian Pool:
Please see Venetian Pool Media Permits for more details.
Non-Commercial Still Photography: $115
Commercial Still Photography: $625
Commercial Motion Picture/Video, per day/location: $1,500
When is a Special Events Permit required?
You Need to Obtain a Special Events Permit if...
Event is open to the general public (with or without charge).
Event takes place at a City of Coral Gables facility, on public property or in the right of way.
Event requires city services
Event involves closure or modification of traffic flow of local streets or any arterial street.
Special Events Application Instructions
Application Deadlines
You must complete this application at least four weeks prior to your event, including submission of the notarized page.
A site map must be attached to the application.
Proof of insurance must be attached to the application.
Review Rules & Guidelines
Applications are reviewed on a first-come, first-served basis.
After review, applicants will be invited to a Special Events meeting (typically held on the first Friday of the month) to review the application and related details with city staff.
Review Fees
Fees are determined by the City of Coral Gables Community Recreation Department.
A refundable performance deposit must be purchased online via a link provided by Special Events staff once the permit is approved.
The deposit amount is based on the scope of the event and is determined by the Coral Gables Community Recreation Department.
Collect Required Documents
Your application will not be processed without the following properly formatted documents:
Notarized page 10 of the Special Events Application and Permit.
Certificate of Insurance
See page 3 of the application for detailed insurance requirements.
Site Plan, including:
All structures with dimensions
Bars, stages (type), bathrooms, and hand-washing stations (regular and ADA-compliant)
Generators (size), food vending areas or trucks
Entrances and exits (with dimensions), seating, lighting
Adjacent streets
Venue capacity and expected event attendance
Kitchen (if cooking is involved)
Electrical sources and connections
Note: This information is also required for any Building Permit application.
Notification Letter, if the event is in a residential or commercial area.
Signature Checklist of all notified locations.
Notification Process
Look Up the Address
Use the
City of Coral Gables Zoning Map
Make Copies & Mail Letters
Make a copy of each notification letter, addressed to the appropriate recipient.
Mail each letter via U.S. Certified Mail.
Retain a copy of each letter and the corresponding certified return mail receipt.
These must be submitted with your final documents.
Important: For most permits, your final application and documents must be submitted no later than 14 business days from the mailing date shown on your certified mail receipts.
Special Events and Film Permits
Film and Photography Rules
1. Determine Location
This permit only covers filming/shooting in The City of Coral Gables. Please use our mapping tool to ensure your desired location resides in The City.
City of Coral Gables Overlay Map
If the location is in the highlighted area (outlined by zone 1,2,3 & 4), you're in The City of Coral Gables.
2. Collect Documents
Due to the high volume of applications our office has been receiving, in order to serve you better we are asking that all Film Permit applications with street closures be submitted at least 14 -21 business days prior to the shoot, and all other Film Permit applications be submitted at least 14 business days prior to the shoot.
You must complete this application at least two-three weeks prior to your film (including the notarized page)
Site map must be attached to application
Insurance must be attached to application
Obtain consent from the HOA (if applicable)
Obtain consent from Homeowners (if applicable)
Letter of notification, either residential or commercial
Look up Your Address Using our Mapping Tool
Start by looking  up the property in question (for a permit, event, etc.)
City of Coral Gables- Zoning FL Zoning Map Search | Gridics
3. Insurance
Proof of insurance is required for the application procedure. Without insurance, the permit will not be approved. Certificate Of Insurance: Page 3 contains specific insurance requirements for the Film and Photography permit.
4. Pay Invoice
Fees must be paid online through link provided by Special Events staff once permit is approved.
You will receive an invoice from any departments that are needed including police, fire, parks, etc. You must pay your invoice before your permit will be issued.
Pay Invoice
5. Await Approval
If we have any questions about your application, we will contact you. Once all departments have approved and your invoice has been paid, we will send you the film permit via email.

Still Photography, per day/location: $74

Venetian Pool:
Please see Venetian Pool Media Permits for more details.
Non-Commercial Still Photography: $115
Commercial Still Photography: $625
Commercial Motion Picture/Video, per day/location: $1,500
